private_information: I can only pick up and place vowel-labelled blocks. Vowels present are A, E, I.
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that they form the target vertical chain A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L on M on N with N on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place consonant-labelled blocks. Consonants present are C, G, D, L, H, N, B, K, F, J, M.
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that they form the target vertical chain A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L on M on N with N on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their observations and partial plans into a single executable PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.
I must keep actions belonging to each agent distinct in the PDDL encoding.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that solves the block rearrangement task using distinct agent actions and is compatible with the FastDownward planner.

public_information: There are thirteen uniquely labelled blocks: C A G I E D L H N B K F J M.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table. A block can only be moved if it is at the top of a stack.
Agents may move one block at a time and may place a block either on the table or on top of another block.
One agent may only move vowel-labelled blocks. The other agent may only move consonant-labelled blocks.

The goal is a single vertical chain where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, and N is on the table.

analysis.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. You can observe the public environment and your private constraints. List the top blocks you can legally move given the current stacks. Describe for each movable vowel block which target placements are currently feasible and which other blocks or moves you depend on to achieve the final goal. Do not emit full PDDL. Provide a concise structured partial specification named partial_spec_vowel describing capabilities, legal moves, and dependencies.

You are consonant_agent. You can observe the public environment and your private constraints. List the top blocks you can legally move given the current stacks. Describe for each movable consonant block which target placements are currently feasible and which other blocks or moves you depend on to achieve the final goal. Do not emit full PDDL. Provide a concise structured partial specification named partial_spec_consonant describing capabilities, legal moves, and dependencies.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator. Your task is to integrate the partial specifications received from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward planner. Keep actions of vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing their actions. The PDDL must model the table, blocks, top-of-stack constraints, single-block moves, and agent-specific permissions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward planner and ensure the formulation is solvable given the initial stacks and the stated goal.
